com.absynth.battleship.data

Class BattleshipBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absynth.battleship.data.BattleshipBoard

  • public class BattleshipBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a game board for a custom Battleship game.
    Author:
    David Boivin (Absynth)

    • Constructor Detail

      • BattleshipBoard

        public BattleshipBoard(Player p1,
                       Player p2)
        Default constructor which creates a game board with this allowed coordinates o the Coord class.
        Parameters:
        players - Takes any amount of players.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Provide a way to set up the board by allowing each Player to choose the location of all grenades and ships each player can place. The amount of grenades placeable by player is given by GRENADE_AMOUNT and that of ships SHIP_AMOUNT.

        Note: Player one picks first, and since each cell can only contain one content (and by extension owner), player two cannot choose cells chosen by player one.

      • unhideCell

        private void unhideCell(Coord c)
        Provides a way to unhide a specific cell. This is useful if a Player has Player.fire()ed at the given cell and the board needs to display the content.
        Parameters:
        c - The cell to unhide.

      • playTurn

        public boolean playTurn()
        Method which will run through a regular turn in the battleship game. This method relies on an internal turn member variable which is managed/updated by this method. This runs as follows
        1. Checks which player's turn it is
        2. Checks if player's turn is skipped
        3. Asks the user to fire
        4. Checks the content inside the chosen cell and takes appropriate action
        5. Checks if there has been a winner
        Returns:
        true if a player has won, and false if the game is not over and another turn should be played.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a grid of the corresponding cell's content (or Cell.HIDE_CHARACTER) Separated by spaces and formatted based on player. The whole grid is indented.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • nextTurn

        private void nextTurn()
        Updates the internal turn variable.

      • playerSetup

        private void playerSetup(Player p)
        Method to set up a player on the board.
        Parameters:
        p - Player to set up.
        See Also:
        setup()

      • setShip

        private boolean setShip(Coord c,
                        Player p)
        Method which sets the content of the given coordinate to Content.SHIP which is owned by the given player.

        Note: if the coordinate could not be mapped to a cell or the cell is occupied Player.invalidPlacement(String) is called with the appropriate error message.
        Parameters:
        c - Coordinate to place ship.
        p - Owner of the ship.
        Returns:
        true if the content of the cell has been modified.

      • setGrenade

        private boolean setGrenade(Coord c,
                           Player p)
        Method which sets the content of the given coordinate to Content.GRENADE which is owned by the given player.

        Note: if the coordinate could not be mapped to a cell or the cell is occupied Player.invalidPlacement(String) is called with the appropriate error message.
        Parameters:
        c - Coordinate to place grenade.
        p - Owner of the grenade.
        Returns:
        true if the content of the cell has been modified.

      • getCell

        private Cell getCell(Coord c)
        Method to retrieve a cell based on a given Coord. This method is also a good check to see if the Coord is a valid one, since if the coord falls outside the range of the board, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        c - The coordinate to retrieve the cell from.
        Returns:
        The cell at the given cordinate or null

      • getColNumber

        private int getColNumber(char c)
        Loops though all possible characters for columns and checks if the given character matches any and returns that index. Method provides a map from character to index in board. This method is brute force but since the Coord.COL_CHARCTERS is very small, this method should run fast enough.

        Note: will output a value of -1 if the character is not an accepted column character indicated by COL_CHARACTERS,
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:

      • hasWon

        private boolean hasWon(Player p)
        Checks if player has won by checking win condition:
        p.getPoints() >= BattleshipBoard.SHIP_AMOUNT
        Parameters:
        p - The player to check the win condition on.
        Returns:
        true if the win condition has been met by the given player or false if it has not been.
